LocalizedText.Replace: <+4 Influence points per turn toward earning city-state [ICON_Envoy] Envoys. +4 [ICON_Gold] Or pour chaque Cité-État de laquelle vous êtes Suzerain.

Replace.Text: Toutes les unités de Siège Classique et de la Renaissance gagnent +5 [ICON_Strength] force de Combat. +100% [ICON_Production] Production des unités de Siège Classique et Renaissance et les unités de Support de l'Antiquité, Classique et Médiévale.
Unité Temerienne de Mélée unique de l'ère Médiévale +5 [ICON_Strength] quand se bat en Forêt ou en Jungle.
+5 [ICON_Science] Science et +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture. +2 Points par Grand Scientifique

Accumule 25% moins de lassitude de guerre que d'habitude. Coût de maintenande des Unités réduit de 1 Or par tour, par unité. +7 [ICON_Strength] Force de Combat lors d'attaque de Cité-État. Toutes les Villes que vous fondez ou conquérez, si à portée d'une [ICON_TradeRoute] Route Commerciale de votre [ICON_Capital] Capitale, Elles démarrent avec une route vers elles. Vos [ICON_TradeRoute] Routes Commerciale gagnent +1 [ICON_Gold] Or en passant dans vos Postes de Traite dans vos propre Villes.
Flamme Blanche qui Danse sur la Tombe de ses Ennemis.

Capture les unités ennemies en tant que Bâtisseurs. 1 niveau de [ICON_VisLimited] Visibilité Diplomatique supérieur à la normal avec chaque civilisation qu'il a rencontré. Reçoit la capacité de construire un Espion supplémentaire avec la découverte des Châteaux.
Unité Nilfgaardienne de Mélée unique de l'ère Médiévale, remplace épéiste. +5 [ICON_Strength] Force de Combat dans vos territoires ou adjacent à vos territoires.
Unité Nilfgaardienne à Distance unique, remplace arbalétrier. +5 [ICON_Strength] force de Combat lors d'attaque.

LocalizedText.Replace: <Unité Nilfgaardienne de Cavalerie Légère unique de l'ère Médiévale, remplace cavalier. +100% flanking bonus.

Replace.Text: Vos [ICON_TradeRoute] Routes Commerciale vers les autres civilisations fournissent +4 [ICON_Gold] Or pour la Rédanie. Other civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to Redania provide +2 [ICON_Food] Food for them and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Redania. +4 [ICON_Food] Food from domestic [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes.

LocalizedText.Replace: <+50% [ICON_Production] Production toward Spies. Spy operations take 25% less time. Enemy Spies level reduced by 2 in your lands. 1 level of [ICON_VisLimited] Diplomatic Visibility greater than normal with every civilization that she's met. Receives capacity to build an extra Spy with the Castles technology.

Replace.Text: Les Inquisiteurs peuvent retirer l'Hérésie une fois supplémentaire. Les Unités de Combat ont un bonus de +4 [ICON_Strength] Force de Combat contres les joueurs croyant en une autre Religion.
Unité Rédanienne unique anti-cavalerie. +5 [ICON_Strength] Force de Combat si au moins un Fantassin Rédanien adjacent.
Bâtiment unique à la Rédanie. Donne +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Aménité et les unités en garnison donnent +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Aménité.
+5 [ICON_Science] Science et +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture. +1 Points pour les Grands Scientifiques, Écrivains et Artistes.
+1 [ICON_Gold] Or dans le Quartier Commercial, +1 [ICON_Faith] Foi dans le Site Sacré et +1 [ICON_Production] Production dans les Zones Industrielles si elles sont à côtés d'une Forêt.

Réduit le coût d'achat d'une case de 40%. +4 [ICON_Strength] Force de Combat lors de combat contre des civilisations qui croient en d'autres religions. 1 niveau de [ICON_VisLimited] Visibilité Diplomatique supérieure à la normale avec chaque civilisation qu'elle rencontre.
Unité Kaedwenienne de Cavalerie Légère unique de l'ère Médièvale, remplace Cavalier. Peut bouger après avoir attaqué et traverser les Collines plus rapidement.

Units gain the ability to enter Ocean tiles after researching the Shipbuilding technology. Naval units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in shallow water tiles. Naval units can perform costal raids.
Land units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in land tiles adjacent to Coast. Units ignore additional [ICON_Movement] Movement costs from embarking and disembarking.
Skellige unique naval unit, replace Galley. Yields 60% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] as [ICON_Gold] on combat victory.
Unique Skellige building that replace the Lighthouse. Gives +2 [ICON_Food] Food, +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing and +2 Points for Great Admiral.
+100% Commercial Hub and Industrial Zone district adjacency bonuses. Luxury resources in his territory provide an [ICON_Amenities] Amenity to 2 extra cities.
Aedirn unique Medieval era ranged unit, replace Crossbowman. +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting civilizations that follow other Religions.
Aedirn unique building that replace the Workshop. Gives 3 [ICON_Production] Production, 1 [ICON_Gold] Gold, 2 Points for Great Engineer and 1 Points for Great Merchants.
All districts receive an additional standard adjacency bonus for being adjacent to another district.
Rivian Crossbowman unique Medieval era ranged unit, replace Crossbowman. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. melee and ranged units.

Lyrian and Rivian unique improvement. Occupying unit receives +6[ICON_Strength] Defense Strength and automatically gains 2 turns of fortification. Gives 1 Housing and if its next to a River adds 1[ICON_Culture] Culture.
+1 [ICON_Gold] Gold in the Commercial Hub, +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith in the Holy Site, +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture in the Theatre and +1 [ICON_Science] Science in the Campus if they are next to a Forest.
Additional Wildcard policy slot. +2 [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist points per turn and +2 [ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writer points per turn.
Scoia'tael unique Medieval melee unit, replace Swordsman and doesn't require Iron. Can move and see through Woods and Rainforest.Cannot be seen in the woods or jungle unless they are adjacent to it.
Scoia'tael unique Medieval ranged cavalry unit. Can move and see through Woods and Rainforest. Cannot be seen in the woods or jungle unless they are adjacent to it.
Scoia'tael unique Medieval ranged unit, replace Crossbowman. Can move and see through Woods and Rainforest. Cannot be seen in the woods or jungle unless they are adjacent to it.

All cities you found or conquer start with a Trading Post.Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes earn +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for passing through Trading Posts in your own cities. Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Kovir. Other civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to Kovir provide +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Kovir.

+2 Influence points per turn toward earning city-state [ICON_Envoy] Envoys. 1 level of [ICON_VisLimited] Diplomatic Visibility greater than normal with every civilization that she's met. Receives capacity to build an extra Spy with the Castles technology.

Kovir and Poviss unique building that replace the Market. Gives +3 [ICON_Gold] and 2 Points for Great Merchants. [ICON_RESOURCE_COPPER] Copper, [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron, [ICON_RESOURCE_SILVER] Silver, [ICON_RESOURCE_PEARLS] Pearls, [ICON_RESOURCE_DIAMONDS] Diamonds, [ICON_RESOURCE_JADE] Jade and [ICON_RESOURCE_SALT] Salt resources gain +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold each.

Combat victories provide [ICON_Gold] Gold equal to 100% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit. +50% [ICON_Gold] Gold in cities not on your original [ICON_Capital] Capital's continent. +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold from all [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes.

+5% [ICON_Culture] Culture per city-state you are the Suzerain of. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Science] Science from international [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes. +100% [ICON_Science] Science from Campus district buildings Library and University.

+100% [ICON_Production] Production toward Ancient, Classical, Renaissance and Industrial era naval units. Receives [ICON_Science] Science or [ICON_Culture] Culture from [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to civilizations that are more advanced than Bran (+1 per 3 technologies or civics ahead).
All units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking wounded units. When they eliminate a unit, they heal up to 50 hit points.
One extra Wildcard policy slot in any government. Units receive a +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when in your territory or adjacent to your territory.
Skellige unique meele unit. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against damaged units.
Eithné unique ranged unit. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking and -7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending.
Temeria unique anticavalry unit. 75% flanking bonus.
Northern unique siege unit. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one Trebuchet adjacent.
Nilfgaard unique siege unit. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. melee and ranged units.
Nilfgaard unique siege unit. +1 base movement.
Nilfgaard unique heavy cavalry unit. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one Alba Division adjacent.
Skellige melee unit unit. Does not suffer combat penalties when damaged.
Skellige ranged unit unit. Half of the attack of the Crossbowman, but can attack twice per turn.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending in Woods, Jungle, Hills, or Marsh.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in or adjacent to its home territory.

Kaewdin unique Medieval cavalry unit, replace Knight. Pushes defending enemy units back from their hex in any battle where they score more damage. Defenders that cannot retreat suffer additional damage.
Redanian unique Medieval cavalry unit, replace Knight. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. melee and ranged units.
Northern Realms unique Medieval era ranged unit. Heals at the end of every turn, even after moving or attacking.
